intro: Acrocorion, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange ray flowers surrounding a central disk of smaller florets. Acrocorion typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its botanical structure supports pollination by insects, contributing to its ecological role in native habitats.
